title: noNewSymbol
description: |
  Disallow `new` operators with the `Symbol` object.
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

**Diagnostic Category: `lint/correctness/noNewSymbol`**
<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
:::caution[Deprecated]
This rule is deprecated and will be removed in the next major release.
**Reason**: Use `noInvalidNewBuiltin` instead.
:::
**Since**: `v1.0.0`
:::note
- This rule has an **unsafe** fix.
:::

Sources: 
- Same as: <a href="https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/no-new-symbol" target="_blank"><code>no-new-symbol</code></a>

Disallow `new` operators with the `Symbol` object.

`Symbol` cannot be instantiated. This results in throwing a `TypeError`.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
var foo = new Symbol('foo');
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:1:11 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/no-new-symbol">lint/correctness/noNewSymbol</a> <span style="color: #000; style="color: Tomato;">·</span></span>Symbol('foo');<br />  <strong>    │ </strong>          <span style="color: Tomato;">-</span><span style="color: Tomato;">-</span><span style="color: ### Valid

```js
var bar = Symbol('bar');
function baz() {
    function Symbol() { }
    new Symbol();
}
```
